Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: One of SYG 2000, ANT 2000, PSY 2012, or Junior standing.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Exploration of contemporary sociology. Conceptual analysis and methodological techniques, presentation and utilization of sociological literature on major social institutions.

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: One of SYG 2000, ANT 2000, or PSY 2012, or Junior standing.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Explores the ways in which non-human animals both enhance and diminish humans' health.

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: One of SYG 2000, ANT 2000, PSY 2012, or Junior standing.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The relationship between the religious institution and social stratification, family, education, as well as issues pertaining to gender, race, ethnicity, and age.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: One of SYG 2000, ANT 2000, PSY 2012, or Junior standing.

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: One of SYG 2000, ANT 2000, PSY 2012, or Junior standing.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: A sociological examination of mental illness as a social problem; legal aspects of mental illness, and the mental health professions.

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: Sophomore standing or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The impact of globalization on families by using travel outside of the U.S. as an instructional vehicle.

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: One of SYG 2000, ANT 2000, PSY 2012, or Junior standing.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Study of class, status and power, cultural variations in stratification systems; patterns of mobility and change.

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: One of SYG 2000, ANT 2000, PSY 2012, or Junior standing.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Intimate relationships, practices, trends and issues affecting today's marriages and families.

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: One of SYG 2000, ANT 2000, PSY 2012, or Junior standing.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The formation of social systems in response to social problems and the implementation of public policy. Emphasis on diverse perspectives and ethical positions and their effect on the form and effectiveness of social systems.

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: Consent of Honors or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Analysis of patient behavior, health practitioners, the social organization of health services, and delivery of health care. With Honors content.

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: SYG 2000, ANT 2000, PSY 2012, or Junior Standing

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Patterns of social relations among social actors within a defined population are demonstrated allowing students to better understand the theory and application of social networks.

SYO4133 - Family and Aging in Society.name: SYO4133 - Family and Aging in Society

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: SYG 2000, SYG 2010 or Junior Standing.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: A sociological perspective on human aging as it relates to the institution of family.

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: SYG 2000, ANT 2000 or PSY 2012 or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Examination of the ways social characteristics structure or shape health patterns in the U.S. population.

SYO4402 - Sociology of Health and Illnes.name: SYO4402 - Sociology of Health and Illness Behavior

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: One of SYG 2000, ANT 2000, or PSY 2012, or Junior standing.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Social construction of health and illness, and social factors that shape health and illness behavior (e.g., subjective experience of illness, patient-doctor interaction, and coping with disability).

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: One of SYG 2000, ANT 2000, PSY 2012, or Junior standing.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Sociological analysis of political and parapolitical groups; socioeconomic variable of voting behavior, power elites; societies and systems of government.

Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: Consent of Honors or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: A sociological examination of mental illness as a social problem; legal aspects of mental illness, and the mental health professions. With Honors content.

Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: SYG 2000, ANT 2000, PSY 2012, or Junior Standing

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Applies a sociological lens to understand and explain how health care is sought and negotiated in the United States.

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: SYG 2000, ANT 2000, PSY 2012, or Junior Standing.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Explores health sociologically as it exists in the U.S. at the intersections of gender, race, ethnicity, age, class, sexual orientation and society.

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: SYG 2000 , ANT 2000, PSY 2012 or Junior Standing.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Explores how masculine gendered identities at various stages during the lifecourse intersect with health, illness, and disease.

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: One of SYG 2000, ANT 2000, PSY 2012, or Junior standing.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: This course examines the sociological dimensions of the educational institutions, including the impact of the social structure on learning and the role of education in social change.

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: One of SYG 2000, ANT 2000, PSY 2012, or Junior standing.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Analysis of patient beliefs and behavior, health practitioners, the social organization of hospitals and health services, contemporary problems in the delivery of health care.
